org.sd.xml
Class XmlTagRipper

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.xml.XmlTagRipper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<XmlLite.Tag>
public class XmlTagRipper
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Iterator<XmlLite.Tag>

Utility class to rip tags from xml without pre-interpreting the full xml structure.

Author:
Spence Koehler

XmlTagRipper

public XmlTagRipper(java.lang.String filename,
                    boolean isHtml,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ignoreTags)
             throws java.io.IOException
Construct an instance to rip text from the given file, ignoring certain tags.

Parameters:
filename - The name of the file containing xml text to rip.
isHtml - True if file is html and special script logic is to be applied.
ignoreTags - Tags to ignore and skip.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                    boolean isHtml,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ignoreTags)
             throws java.io.IOException
Construct an instance to rip text from the given input stream, ignoring certain tags.

ignoreTags - Tags to ignore and skip.
Throws:

XmlTagRipper

public XmlTagRipper(java.io.InputStream inputStream,
                    boolean isHtml,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> ignoreTags,
                    boolean requireXmlTag)
             throws java.io.IOException
Construct an instance to rip text from the given input stream, ignoring certain tags.

Parameters:
inputStream - The stream containing xml text to rip.
isHtml - True if file is html and special script logic is to be applied.
ignoreTags - Tags to ignore and skip.
requireXmlTag - true if finding an xml tag in the stream is required. NOTE: if this is true and an xml tag is not found, the ripper will behave as if an encoding exception was hit and will appear empty.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

hitEncodingException

public boolean hitEncodingException()
Report whether the last string returned by "next" hit an encoding exception during parsing.

ripNode

public Tree<XmlLite.Data> ripNode(XmlLite xmlLite)
Rip the full node whose root is the tag last returned by "next" using the given xmlLite instance to parse.

NOTE: After ripping a node, iteration will continue after the node, not after the last returned tag. There is a buffer limit of 32K such that if in reading to the next tag this size is exceeded, the node cannot be ripped.

ripText

public java.lang.String ripText()
Rip the text under the current tag using default html parsing.

ripText

public java.lang.String ripText(XmlLite xmlLite)
Rip the text under the current tag unsing the given parsing.
